subject: Subjects
defaultTip: Use \\ and \ cr to wrap lines. Related links include

list.name: \pm
list.tip: Plus or minus, plus is on top. Related\mp
equal :=approximate:\eqsim greater than or equal to:\ge less than or equal to:\le equivalent:\equiv

list.name: \not=
list.tip: \not apply to the following characters, can draw strikeout

list.name: \times
list.tip: Multiplication can be denoted by \times. Symbol * can also be used to denote multiplication

list.name: \propto
list.tip: Symbol of normal asymptotic distribution, variant form denotes by \varpropto

list.name: \lt
list.tip: Symbol of less than, \lt denotes less-than, in html, <> has been used, suggest to use \It and \gt to denote greater than and less than

list.name: \ll
list.tip: Use to I to denote far less than, related:\It,\lll

list.name: \gt
list.tip: Symbol of greater than, \gt denotes greater-than, in html, <>has been used, suggest to use \lt and \gt to denote greater than and lesser than

list.name: \gg
list.tip: Use two g to denote far greater than, related:\gt\ggg\gggtr

list.name: \le
list.tip: less&equal is the short form of less than or equal to, related \lt\ge

list.name: \ge
list.tip: greater&equal is the short form of greater and equal to, related\lt\ge

list.name: \mp
list.tip: Minus-plus sign, minus sign is on top, plus sign is below

list.name: \cong
list.tip: short form of congruent denotes equivalent. Related:\ncog

list.name: \sqrt{x}
list.tip: Use \sqrt [index]{radicand}to denote radical, or use \root to denote index \of to denote radical

list.name: \sqrt[3]{x}
list.tip: Use \sqrt [index]{radicand}to denote radical, or use \root to denote index \of to denote radical
% denotes single-line comments in mathjax, sign of percentage is denoted by \%

list.name: ^{\circ}F
list.tip: Fahrenheit degree, use \circ sign to coordinate with the top and bottom’s corner marks to show relative signs

list.name: ^{\circ}C
list.tip: Celsius degree, use \circ sign to coordinate with the top and bottom’s corner marks to show relative signs

list.name: \alpha
list.tip: Lower case of Alpha, use \A to denote upper case

list.name: \beta
list.tip: Lower case of Beta, use  \B to denote upper case

list.name: \gamma
list.tip: Lower case of Gamma, use \Gamma to denote upper case, use \varGamma to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \delta
list.tip: Lower case of Delta, use \Delta to denote upper case, use \varDelta to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \epsilon
list.tip: Lower case of Epsilon, use \E to denote upper case, use \varepsilon to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \varepsilon
list.tip: Lower case of variation of Epsilon, use \epsilon to denote variation of lower case, use E to denote upper case

list.name: \zeta
list.tip: Lower case of Zeta, use \Z to denote upper case

list.name: \eta
list.tip: Lower case of Eta, use \H to denote upper case

list.name: \theta
list.tip: Theta, use \Theta to denote upper case, use \vartheta to denote variation of lower case, use \varTheta to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \vartheta
list.tip: Variation of lower case of Theta, use \theta to denote proper case, use \Theta to denote upper case, use \varTheta to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \iota
list.tip: Lower case of Iota, use \I to denote upper case

list.name: \kappa
list.tip: Lower case of Kappa, use \K to denote upper case, use \varkappa to denote variation of lower case

list.name: \lambda
list.tip: Lower case of Lambda, use \Lambda to denote upper case, use \varlambda to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \mu
list.tip: Lower case of Mu, use \M to denote upper case

list.name: \nu
list.tip: Lower case of Nu, use \N to denote upper case

list.name: \xi
list.tip: Lower case of Xi, use \Xi to denote upper case, use \varXi to denote variation of upper case

list.name: o
list.tip: Lower case of Omicron, use \O to denote upper case

list.name: \pi
list.tip: lowercase style, uppercase style denotes by   PI, lowercase style denotes by   varpi, uppercase style   varpi

list.name: \rho
list.tip: Lower case of Rho, use \P to denote upper case, use \varrho to denote variation of lower case

list.name: \varrho
list.tip: Variation of lower case of Rho, use \rho to denote proper case, use \P to denote upper case

list.name: \sigma
list.tip: Lower case of Sigma, use \Sigma to denote upper case, equal to the summation sign. Use \varsigma to denote variation of lower case, use \varSigma to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \varsigma
list.tip: Lower case of Sigma, use \Sigma to denote proper case, use \Sigma to denote upper case, equal to the summation sign \sum. Use \varSigma to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \tau
list.tip: Lower case of Tao, use \T to denote upper case

list.name: \upsilon
list.tip: Lower case of Upsilon, use \Upsilon to denote upper case, use \varupsilon to denote variation of lower case, use \varUpsilon to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \phi
list.tip: Lower case of Phi, use \Phi to denote upper case, use \varphi to denote variation of lower case, use \varPhi to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \varphi
list.tip: Lower case of Phi, use \phi to denote proper case, use \Phi to denote upper case, use \varPhi to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \chi
list.tip: Lower case of Chi, use \X to denote upper case

list.name: \psi
list.tip: Lower case of Psi, use \Psi to denote upper case, use \varPsi to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \omega
list.tip: Lower case of Omega, use \Omega to denote upper case, use \varOmega to denote variation of upper case

list.name: A
list.tip: Upper case of Alpha, use \alpha to denote lower case

list.name: B
list.tip: Upper case of Beta, use \beta to denote lower case

list.name: \Gamma
list.tip: Upper case of Gamma, use \gamma to denote lower case, use \varGamma to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \Delta
list.tip: Upper case of Delta, use \delta to denote lower case, use \varDelta to denote variation of upper case

list.name: E
list.tip: Upper case of Epsilon, use \epsilon to denote lower case, use \varepsilon to denote variation of lower case

list.name: Z
list.tip: Upper case of Zeta, use \zeta to denote lower case

list.name: H
list.tip: Upper case of Eta, use \eta to denote lower case

list.name: \Theta
list.tip: Upper case of Theta, use \theta to denote lower case, use \vartheta to denote variation of lower case, use \varTheta to denote variation of upper case

list.name: I
list.tip: Upper case of Iota, use \iota to denote upper case

list.name: K
list.tip: Upper case of Kappa, use \kappa to denote lower case, use \varkappa to denote variation of lower case

list.name: \Lambda
list.tip: Upper case of Lambda, use \lambda to denote lower case, use \varLambda to denote variation of upper case

list.name: M
list.tip: Upper case of Mu, use \mu to denote lower case

list.name: N
list.tip: Upper case of Nu, use \nu to denote lower case

list.name: \Xi
list.tip: Upper case of Xi, use \xi to denote lower case, use \varXi to denote variation of upper case

list.name: O
list.tip: Upper case of Omicron, use \omicron to denote lower case

list.name: \Pi
list.tip: Upper case of Pi, use \pi to denote lower case, use \varPi to denote variation lower case, use \varPi to denote variation upper case

list.name: P
list.tip: Upper case of Rho, use \P to denote lower case, use \varrho to denote variation of lower case

list.name: \Sigma
list.tip: Upper case of Sigma, equals to the summation sign \sum. Use \sigma to denote lower case. Use \varsigma to denote variation of lower case, use \varSigma to denote variation of upper case

list.name: T
list.tip: Upper case of Tau, use \tau to denote lower case

list.name: \Upsilon
list.tip: Upper case of Upsilon, use \upsilon to denote lower case, use \varupsilon to denote variation of lower case, use \varUpsilon to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \Phi
list.tip: Upper case of Phi, use \phi to denote lower case, use \varphi to denote variation of lower case, use \varPhi to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \varPhi
list.tip: Upper case of Phi, use \phi to denote lower case, use \varphi to denote variation of lower case, use \varPhi to denote variation of upper case

list.name: X
list.tip: Upper case of Chi, use \chi to denote lower case

list.name: \Psi
list.tip: Upper case of Chi, use \chi to denote lower case, use \varPsi to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \Omega
list.tip: Upper case ofOmega, use\ omega to denote lower case, use\ varOmega to denote variation of upper case

list.name: \iota
list.tip: Lower case of Iota, use \I  to denote upper case

list.name: \mathbb{N}
list.tip: Upper case N sign, denotes natural numbers set

list.name: \mathbb{Q}
list.tip: Upper case Q sign, denotes rational numbers set

list.name: \mathbb{R}
list.tip: Board body R, denotes real numbers set

list.name: \mathbb{Z}
list.tip: Board body Z, denotes whole numbers set

list.name: \mathcal{e}
list.tip: Hand-written e, denotes natural index number sign
Plus sign is denoted by itself

list.name: \pm
list.tip: Plus-minus sign, plus on the top. Related:\mp

list.name: \mp
list.tip: Minus-plus sign, plus on the top. Related:\pm

list.name: \circ
list.tip: Circle sign, complex function action sign

list.name: \le
list.tip: Less than or equal to sign, related:\It\ge

list.name: \ge
list.tip: Greater than or equal to , related:\gt\le

list.name: \not\le
list.tip: Neither less than nor equal to

list.name: \not\ge
list.tip: Neither greater than nor equal to

list.name: \mathcal{abcdefg}
list.tip: Lower case variation letter, can be denoted by \cal

list.name: \mathcal{ABCDEFG}
list.tip: Upper case variation letter, can be denoted by \cal

list.name: \mathbb{abcdefg}
list.tip: Black board letter, can be denoted by \Bbb

list.name: \mathbb{ABCDEFG}
list.tip: Black board letter, can be denoted by \Bbb

list.name: \mathfrak{abcdefg}
list.tip: Ancient German letter, can be denoted by \frak

list.name: \mathfrak{ABCDEFG}
list.tip: Ancient German letter, can be denoted by \frak

list.name: \sqrt{x}
list.tip: Use \sqrt [index]{radicand}to denote radical, square root can be denoted by \sqrt{}. Related:\root

list.name: \sqrt[2]{x}
list.tip: Use \sqrt [index]{radicand}to denote radical, square root can be denoted by \sqrt{}. Related:\root

list.name: x_a
list.tip: Use_ to denote subscript, if subscript is more than a sign, use {} to contain. Related^

list.name: x^a
list.tip: Use ^ to denote superscript, if superscript is more than a sign, use {} to contain. Related _

list.name: x_a^b
list.tip: Subscript and superscript exist at the same time

list.name: x^{y^2}
list.tip: There is a composite structure in superscript

list.name: \dfrac {\pi} {2}
list.tip: Fraction can be denoted by \frac{numerator}{denominator} or \dfrac{numerator}{denominator} . The former can be adjusted according to the display of lines and equation, the latter display consistently in both lines and equation

list.name: a / b
list.tip: The horizontal form of fraction is usually used to denote simple fractions

list.name: \frac ab
list.tip: Fraction can be denoted by \frac{numerator}{denominator} or \dfrac{numerator}{denominator} . The former can be adjusted according to the display of lines and equation, the latter display consistently in both lines and equation

list.name: \frac{a+1}{b+1}
list.tip: Fraction can be denoted by \frac{numerator}{denominator} or \dfrac{numerator}{denominator} . The former can be adjusted according to the display of lines and equation, the latter display consistently in both lines and equation

list.name: \ln x
list.tip: Logarithm function with a natural number as base number, related:\log
Parenthesis, can use \left and \right to adjust the height
Square bracket, can use \left and \right to adjust the height
Vertical separator, can use \left and \right to adjust the height
Brace, use transform backslash expressions to denote

list.name: \langle\rangle
list.tip: Angle bracket, can use \left and \right to adjust the height

list.name: \lbrack\rbrack
list.tip: Square bracket, can use \left and \right to adjust the height

list.name: \lceil \rceil
list.tip: Left and right corner sign, can use \left and \right to adjust the height

list.name: \lgroup \rgroup
list.tip: Can use \left and \right to adjust the height
Angle bracket, can use \left and \right to adjust the height

list.name: \lfloor \rfloor
list.tip: Left and right corner sign , can use \left and \right to adjust the height

list.name: \lmoustache \rmoustache
list.tip: Beard , can use \left and \right to adjust the height

list.name: \Vert \Vert
list.tip: Norm tag, can use \left and \right to adjust the height

list.name: \tbinom n k
list.tip: Binomial distribution coefficient denotes, related:\binom n k

list.name: \binom n k
list.tip: Binomial distribution coefficient , related:\binom n k

list.name: f(x) = \begin{cases} -x,  &x<0 \cr  x,  &x>0 \end{cases}
list.tip: Piecewise fraction, use \begin{case} equation\end{cases} to denote

list.name: \dot A
list.tip: Dot label, usually used on derivatives

list.name: f'(x)
list.tip: The first derivative of function label

list.name: \int_0^{\pi}{dx}
list.tip: Integral label 1, integration is limited on the left

list.name: \intop\limits_{x}^{y} dx
list.tip: Integral label 2, integration is limited on the top and bottom

list.name: \iint_0^{\pi}{dxdy}
list.tip: Double integral label, integration is limited on the right. Use \limits_{lower limit}^{upper limit} to denotes upper and lower limits’ label

list.name: \iint\limits_0^{\pi}{dxdy}
list.tip: Double integral label, integration is limited on top and bottom

list.name: \iiint_0^{\pi}dxdydz
list.tip: Triple integral, integration is limited on the right, use \limits_{lower limit}^{upper limit} to denote upper and lower limits’ label

list.name: \iiint\limits_0^\pi dxdydz
list.tip: Triple integral, integration is limited on the top and bottom

list.name: \oint\limits_0^\pi
list.tip: Contour integral, integration is limited on top and bottom

list.name: \oint_0^\pi
list.tip: Contour integral, integration is limited on the right

list.name: \oiint\limits_0^\pi
list.tip: Area integral, integration is limited on top and bottom

list.name: \oiint_0^\pi
list.tip: Area integral, integration is limited on the right

list.name: \oiiint\limits_0^\pi
list.tip: Volume integral label, integration is limited on top and bottom

list.name: \oiiint_0^\pi
list.tip: Volume integral label, integration is limited on the right

list.name: \lim_{n \rightarrow\infty}f(n)
list.tip: Limit, limit label is on the right

list.name: \lim\limits_{n \rightarrow\infty}f(n)
list.tip: Limit, use \limits_{} to display limit label on the right bottom

list.name: \ldots
list.tip: Ellipsis, display on the bottom line position

list.name: \ddots
list.tip: Oblique ellipsis, usually used to denote the omitted part of the matrix

list.name: \matrix {a & b}
list.tip: Single-row matrixes, use & to separate different columns

list.name: \matrix{a \cr b}
list.tip: Single-row matrixes, use \\or\cr to separate different columns

list.name: \left ( \matrix{a & b \cr c & d} \right )
list.tip: Parenthesis surrounds 2*2 matrix, use \left \right to adjust the size of parenthesis automatically

list.name: \left \langle \matrix{a & b \cr c & d} \right \rangle
list.tip: Arrow bracket surrounds 2*2 matrix, use \left \right to adjust the size of parenthesis automatically

list.name: \left \lbrace \matrix{a & b \cr c & d} \right \rbrace
list.tip: Square bracket surrounds 2*2 matrix, use \left \right to adjust the size of parenthesis automatically

list.name: \left \lbrack \matrix{a & b \cr c & d} \right \rbrack
list.tip: Brace surrounds 2*2 matrix, use \left \right to adjust the size of parenthesis automatically

list.name: \left | \matrix{a & b \cr c & d} \right |
list.tip: Vertical line surrounds 2*2 matrix, use \left \right to adjust the size of parenthesis automatically

list.name: \left \Vert \matrix{a & b \cr c & d} \right \Vert
list.tip: Double vertical line surrounds 2*2 matrix, use \left \right to adjust the size of parenthesis automatically

list.name: \begin{bmatrix} aaa & b \cr c & ddd \end {bmatrix}
list.tip: Square bracket surrounds 2*2 matrix, use {bmatrix} environmental label

list.name: \matrix {a & b & c}
list.tip: Matrix 1*3, use & to separate different columns

list.name: \matrix {a \cr b \cr c}
list.tip: Matrix 3*1, use \\ or \cr to separate different columns

list.name: \left[ \begin{array}{cc|c} a&b&c \cr x&y&z \end{array} \right]
list.tip: Augmented matrix, use \begin{array}\end{array} environment, add vertical lines at the aligning label behind \begin{array}, to denote vertical separation { cc|c }

list.name: \begin{array}{lc|r} aaa & bbb & ccc \cr xx & yy & z \cr n & n & n \end{array}
\begin{array}{c|lcr} n & \text{左对齐} & \text{居中对齐} & \text{右对齐} \cr \hline 1 & 0.24 & 1 & 125 \cr 2 & -1 & 189 & -8 \cr 3 & -20 & 2000 & 1+10i \end{array}
list.tip: Tabular matrix. Use aligning label { c|lcr } to add vertical separation lines, use \hline to denote horizontal separation lines

list.name: \pmatrix {a_{11} & a_{12} & \ldots & a_{1n} \cr a_{21} & a_{22} & \ldots & a_{2n} \cr \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \cr a_{m1} & a_{m2} & \ldots & a_{mn} \cr    }
\sum
list.tip: Summation sign, the size of sign will adjust automatically according to the upper and lower limitations

list.name: \sum_{1}^{100}
list.tip: Summation sign, use upper small scale to denote upper and lower limitations

list.name: \sum\limits_{i=1}^{i=100}
list.tip: Summation sign, use \limits_{lower limit}^{upper limit} to display upper and lower limitations on the right above and right below

list.name: \prod
list.tip: Multiplication sign, the size of sign adjust automatically according to the equation

list.name: \prod_{1}^{100}
list.tip: Multiplication sign, upper and lower limits are on the right of the sign

list.name: \prod\limits_{i=1}^{i=100}
list.tip: Multiplication sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right above and right below

list.name: \bigcap_{a}^{b}
list.tip: Intersection sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right

list.name: \bigcap\limits_a^{b}
list.tip: Intersection sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right above and right below

list.name: \bigcup_{a}^{b}
list.tip: Union set sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right

list.name: \bigcup\limits_a^{b}
list.tip: Union set sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right above and right below

list.name: \bigvee_{a}^{b}
list.tip: Disjunction sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right

list.name: \bigvee\limits_a^{b}
list.tip: Disjunction sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right above and right below

list.name: \bigwedge_{a}^{b}
list.tip: Conjunction sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right

list.name: \bigwedge\limits_a^{b}
list.tip: Conjunction sign, upper and lower limits are displayed on the right above and right below

list.name: \sum\limits_{{0 \le x \le m} \atop {0 \lt j \lt n}} P(i,j)
list.tip: Common equation of summation of two variables

list.name: f(n) = \begin{cases} n/2, & \text{if $n$ is even} \cr 3n+1, & \text{if $n$ is odd} \end{cases}
\begin{align} (a+b)^2 &= (a+b)(a+b) \cr &= a^2 + ab + ba + b^2 \cr &= a^2 + 2ab + b^2 \cr \end{align}
\begin{align*}\sum_0^\infty \frac{f^{(n)}(x_0)}{n!}(x-x_0)^n = &f(x_0)+f^{'}(x_0)(x-x_0)+       \frac{f^{''}(x0)}{2!}(x-x_0)^2 \cr &+ \cdots+ \frac{f^{(n)}(x0)}{n!}(x-x_0)^n + \cdots  \end{align*}
list.tip: When equation needs line shifting, use \cr or \, use & to make sure the aligning position

list.name: \pmatrix {a_{11} & a_{12} & \ldots & a_{1n} \cr a_{21} & a_{22} & \ldots & a_{2n} \cr \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \cr a_{m1} & a_{m2} & \ldots & a_{mn} \cr    } \pmatrix {x_1 \cr x_2 \cr \vdots \cr x_m} = \pmatrix {b_1 \cr b_2 \cr \vdots \cr b_m}

\begin{align}& \oint_lH\cdot dl = \int_s J\cdot S + \int_s \frac {\partial D}{\partial t}\cdot ds \tag{1} \cr      &\oint_lE\cdot dl = - \frac{d}{dt}\int_sB\cdot ds  \tag{2} \cr &\oint_s B\cdot ds = - 0  \tag{3} \cr       & \oint_s D \cdot ds = \int_s \rho \cdot dv \tag{4} \end{align}
list.tip: The integral form of Maxwell’s equation

list.name:
egin{align} & 
abla	imes f H = J+ rac {\partial { f{D}}}{\partial t} 	ag{1} \cr      & 
abla 	imes  f E = -  rac {\partial  f{B}}{\partial t} 	ag{2} \[2ex] & 
abla \cdot  f B = 0 	ag{3} \[2ex]       & 
abla \cdot  f E = 0  	ag{4} \end{align}
list.tip: The integral form of Maxwell’s equation
